connector.description: Poll the weather information from Open Weather Map.

camel.source.path.name.name: camel.source.path.name
camel.source.path.name.description: The name value is not used.

camel.source.endpoint.appid.name: camel.source.endpoint.appid
camel.source.endpoint.appid.description: APPID ID used to authenticate the user connected to the API Server

camel.source.endpoint.headerName.name: camel.source.endpoint.headerName
camel.source.endpoint.headerName.description: To store the weather result in this header instead of the message body. This is useable if you want to keep current message body as-is.

camel.source.endpoint.language.name: camel.source.endpoint.language
camel.source.endpoint.language.description: Language of the response. One of: [en] [ru] [it] [es] [sp] [uk] [ua] [de] [pt] [ro] [pl] [fi] [nl] [fr] [bg] [sv] [se] [zh_tw] [zh] [zh_cn] [tr] [hr] [ca]

camel.source.endpoint.mode.name: camel.source.endpoint.mode
camel.source.endpoint.mode.description: The output format of the weather data. One of: [HTML] [JSON] [XML]

camel.source.endpoint.period.name: camel.source.endpoint.period
camel.source.endpoint.period.description: If null, the current weather will be returned, else use values of 5, 7, 14 days. Only the numeric value for the forecast period is actually parsed, so spelling, capitalisation of the time period is up to you (its ignored)

camel.source.endpoint.units.name: camel.source.endpoint.units
camel.source.endpoint.units.description: The units for temperature measurement. One of: [IMPERIAL] [METRIC]

camel.source.endpoint.weatherApi.name: camel.source.endpoint.weatherApi
camel.source.endpoint.weatherApi.description: The API to use (current, forecast/3 hour, forecast daily, station) One of: [Current] [Station] [Hourly] [Daily]

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWh.name: camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWh.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy.name: camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy
camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

camel.source.endpoint.geoLocationProvide.name: camel.source.endpoint.geoLocationProvider
camel.source.endpoint.geoLocationProvide.description: A custum geolocation provider to determine the longitude and latitude to use when no location information is set. The default implementaion uses the ipstack API and requires geolocationAccessKey and geolocationRequestHostIP

camel.source.endpoint.httpClient.name: camel.source.endpoint.httpClient
camel.source.endpoint.httpClient.description: To use an existing configured http client (for example with http proxy)

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.source.endpoint.cnt.name: camel.source.endpoint.cnt
camel.source.endpoint.cnt.description: Number of results to be found

camel.source.endpoint.ids.name: camel.source.endpoint.ids
camel.source.endpoint.ids.description: List of id's of city/stations. You can separate multiple ids by comma.

camel.source.endpoint.lat.name: camel.source.endpoint.lat
camel.source.endpoint.lat.description: Latitude of location. You can use lat and lon options instead of location. For boxed queries this is the bottom latitude.

camel.source.endpoint.location.name: camel.source.endpoint.location
camel.source.endpoint.location.description: If null Camel will try and determine your current location using the geolocation of your ip address, else specify the city,country. For well known city names, Open Weather Map will determine the best fit, but multiple results may be returned. Hence specifying and country as well will return more accurate data. If you specify current as the location then the component will try to get the current latitude and longitude and use that to get the weather details. You can use lat and lon options instead of location.

camel.source.endpoint.lon.name: camel.source.endpoint.lon
camel.source.endpoint.lon.description: Longitude of location. You can use lat and lon options instead of location. For boxed queries this is the left longtitude.

camel.source.endpoint.rightLon.name: camel.source.endpoint.rightLon
camel.source.endpoint.rightLon.description: For boxed queries this is the right longtitude. Needs to be used in combination with topLat and zoom.

camel.source.endpoint.topLat.name: camel.source.endpoint.topLat
camel.source.endpoint.topLat.description: For boxed queries this is the top latitude. Needs to be used in combination with rightLon and zoom.

camel.source.endpoint.zoom.name: camel.source.endpoint.zoom
camel.source.endpoint.zoom.description: For boxed queries this is the zoom. Needs to be used in combination with rightLon and topLat.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThresh.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThreshold
camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThresh.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThresho.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThreshold
camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThresho.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier
camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

camel.source.endpoint.greedy.name: camel.source.endpoint.greedy
camel.source.endpoint.greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay
camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount.name: camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount
camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.

camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel.name: camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel
camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that. One of: [TRACE] [DEBUG] [INFO] [WARN] [ERROR] [OFF]

camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorS.name: camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorService
camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorS.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

camel.source.endpoint.scheduler.name: camel.source.endpoint.scheduler
camel.source.endpoint.scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler

camel.source.endpoint.schedulerPropertie.name: camel.source.endpoint.schedulerProperties
camel.source.endpoint.schedulerPropertie.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.

camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler.name: camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler
camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit.name: camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit
camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options. One of: [NANOSECONDS] [MICROSECONDS] [MILLISECONDS] [SECONDS] [MINUTES] [HOURS] [DAYS]

camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay
camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

camel.source.endpoint.geolocationAccessK.name: camel.source.endpoint.geolocationAccessKey
camel.source.endpoint.geolocationAccessK.description: The geolocation service now needs an accessKey to be used

camel.source.endpoint.geolocationRequest.name: camel.source.endpoint.geolocationRequestHostIP
camel.source.endpoint.geolocationRequest.description: The geolocation service now needs to specify the IP associated to the accessKey you're using

camel.component.weather.bridgeErrorHandl.name: camel.component.weather.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.weather.bridgeErrorHandl.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.weather.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.weather.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.weather.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
